meanings.definition: The act of freeing a slave.
meanings.sent1: The manumission of the enslaved person brought tears of joy to their family.
meanings.sent2: After years of servitude, the manumission of the slave was finally granted.
meanings.sent3: The manumission of the captive was celebrated with a feast in the village.
meanings.sent4: The manumission of the prisoner's chains symbolized a new beginning for them.
meanings.sent5: The manumission of the oppressed was a beacon of hope for others in similar situations.

meanings.definition: The formal act of releasing someone from bondage.
meanings.sent1: The manumission of the prisoner was conducted in front of witnesses.
meanings.sent2: The king's decree allowed for the manumission of all slaves in the kingdom.
meanings.sent3: The manumission of the debtor's obligations was a relief to their family.
meanings.sent4: The manumission of the contract freed the parties from their legal obligations.
meanings.sent5: The manumission of the captive was a moment of great significance in the community.
